posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.68 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ We have enabled optimized media for those with paid backups! For those who want to try it and have paid backups, please go to Settings > Data and storage > Manage storage > Optimize on-device storage.

Optimize Media will delete your local attachments older than 30 days that have been uploaded via your paid backup. Optimized media will render via a compressed thumbnail in chats, and when viewing full screen the original will be retrieved from your backup storage.

Would also recommend making sure you have completed a recent local backup before enabling, just in case anything particularly weird happens.

★ We also updated our video transcoding so hopefully HDR videos are no longer washed out but because this might be device specific, any kind of testing would be appreciated.

Complete list of new commits since 7.67.1:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.67.1…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.67 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.68.0 (162800)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

46 new commits since 7.67.1:

Show commits

  • Support 'allow sealed sender from anyone' in archive. [1]

  • Fix possible invalid username link export. [2]

  • Fix possible issue when exporting thread merge update. [3]

  • Fix possible invalid poll export. [4]

  • Update to libsignal v0.86.6 (now on build-artifacts.signal.org) [5]

  • Update SignalIcons to support flexible icon sources. [6]

  • Handle offline state when pinning messages. [7]

  • Fix call screen timeout with remote video active. [8]

  • Call quality icons and config rotation. [9]

  • Fix spinner build. [10]

  • Add animation to pinned messages. [11]

  • Utilzie url keyboard when entering text into the proxy input. [12]

  • Hide find by username option from add to groups search results. [13]

  • Update ktlint to 1.5.0. [14]

  • Fix share intent handling for multiple images with captions. [15]

  • Add FCM token support to regV5. [16]

  • Add basic reglock support to regV5. [17]

  • Various picture in picture updates. [18]

  • Clear focus when entering gateway selection during badge checkout. [19]

  • Fix video color space transcoding issues. [20]

  • Prevent backup restore service trashing for optimized restore. [21]

  • Fix any potentially stuck thumbnail uploads. [22]

  • Do not allow pinning of gift badges. [23]

  • Fix error when sending stories to unverified recipients. [24]

  • Reactions / Raised hands position adjustment. [25]

  • Remove redundant total members count parameter from recipient picker callbacks. [26]

  • Allow pinned messages to be resendable. [27]

  • Prevent users from continuing while issue is not specified. [28]

  • Fix split pane UI not showing after registration on large screen devices. [29]

  • Fix cancel offload restore banner showing complete bug. [30]

  • Fix spacing between banner. [31]

  • Add optional git hook to run formatter pre-push. [32]

  • Send sync message when unpinning. [33]

  • Fix crash when keyboard animation ends after view destroyed. [34]

  • Fix crash in internal backup settings on wipe and restore. [35]

  • Add nicer call quality animation. [36]

  • Implement new call grid that has animations. [37]

  • Fix in-call status. [38]

  • Enable new calling UI for internal users by default. [39]

  • Fix TransferControlView showing play button on images bug. [40]

  • Update strings. [41]

  • Enable the 'optimize storage' feature for production users. [42]

  • Rotate call quality survey config value. [43]

  • Update strings. [44]

  • Update translations and other static files. [45]

  • Bump version to 7.68.0 [46]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.67.1…v7.68.0

Localization changes

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Optimized media setting not turning on my device

  1. Toggle the setting on
  2. Leave the page
  3. Go back, the setting is off again

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.68.0/fd3cf8305cb55074deb480bfefd93a37778271eed576ce7c93da37f8d9107a22

I don’t want to be a nuisance, but

mtang-signal:

We also updated our video transcribing

the correct term is “transcoding”, I believe

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

Optimized media setting not turning on my device

Ah, will have a fix in .1 to fix this.

TomatoPlant:

the correct term is “transcoding”

Shhhhh (just fixed).

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Niceeeeeee I was waiting for this.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.68.0/6e605ee5fad435cad09e194888f898cc0ea807f42c167d38cb8c2a667b99d6bb

It doesn’t show up on this account which has an active subscription for some reason.

I say for some reason cause I never subscribed for it, yet my main account which does have a subscription, says it’s going to expire lol.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.68.0/f50147f142618d6da45b8601e57d8fb12d91604a5ac4e9bf0ae37bafb566aa7c

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked: Is there any chance that the email you used for the active subscription is also on the device that should not have the subscription?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It’s a work profile with a play store that isn’t logged into. So basically like another device that doesn’t have Play services logged into.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Screenshot_20251211-2158071080×2424 159 KB

When I enabled media optimization, my backup size in settings dropped from 12GB to 1.15GB. To me, and maybe to others, this would indicate that all of the media was just deleted from my cloud backup (although I don’t think that’s actually the case).

Shouldn’t the backup size here reflect the actual size of my backup in the cloud and not the current amount of data on-device?

Also, after enabling media optimization, and after it deleted the media from my device, I decided to test something and found an issue.

I went to a conversation, All Media, and then sorted by Oldest. Clicking on any images older than 30 days resulted in nothing happening. Any thumbnail I tapped on, the photo would not open.

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.68.1/19a6cada03b12b0a94e0846077e7ec1138403d35c0ae761dc806937b31e55327

Thanks!!

posts.name: Saptarshi Biswas
posts.cooked:
I saved a video from a chat, it does not show up in my gallery app (Fossify galley as well as Google photos). Saved a few photos, that shows up!

debug: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.68.1/c6824a2a43ed96e8d1c5a93c5a715c31b224510bb23280584cbfac27f42c1eb4

Did you encounter this before? I’m on 7.67.1 stable but also use fossify gallery and saved a video to disk for testing. The video appears in the gallery app and is stored as Main Storage / Movies / Signal / *.mp4.
I wonder if you maybe haven’t granted full storage permission for fossify gallery and if you use scoped storage framework with dedicated dirs and the maybe-new-directory needs to be added.

posts.name: Saptarshi Biswas
posts.cooked:
I cannot confirm whether its an issue with this specific version as I don’t recall saving any video while i was on a previous version.

Fossify gallery has full access..

I moved the videos from the movies/Signal folder (which previously used to show up) to another folder and it becomes visible in gallery.

The video file is .mpeg format. So, its definitely for a format issue.

I tried to move another video (.mp4) to the Movies/Signal folder, and it shows up in the gallery.

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

Any thumbnail I tapped on, the photo would not open.

Salt505:

Shouldn’t the backup size here reflect the actual size of my backup in the cloud and not the current amount of data on-device?

Both of these issues are fixed in 7.68.2, thank you!!!

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked:
When archiving a chat, the bottom notification that informs that the chat was archived, the one with the undo button, stays visible for way too long obstructing the text input of the chats forcing me to wait until it disappears so that the text input can be visible again and I can start typing.

Not only that, but the pop up us not dismissible, when it should be; I think it was so in the past.

The following bugs from earlier beta releases are still present in 7.68.2:

  • When selecting a message, the menu with options appears higher a bit higher
  • Opening the sticker menu for a second time shows 2 stickers in a row instead of the usual 4
  • Trying to select installed stickers, pressing back brings me to the chat instead of cancelling the selection
  • Weird jumping-up animation when viewing the entire group description.
